questions.text: Why does Jerry like his new couch so much?
questions.explanation:
It doesn't fold out.

	In the beginning of the episode, Jerry is shopping for a new couch and George tells him that he's joined a book club.  Jerry finally picks out a white couch, and he tells Elaine that he likes it because it doesn't fold out and he won't need to have people over to sleep on it.  He gives his old couch to Elaine.

questions.text: Elaine ends up with a new boyfriend in this episode.  What is his job?
questions.explanation:
Deliveryman.

	When the moving men deliver Jerry's couch, Elaine asks one of them to drive the old couch to her apartment.  When they deliver it, she ends up planning a date with one of them.  She tells this to Jerry when they finally decide to have a meal at Poppie's.

questions.text: What does Kramer order for Jerry and Elaine in advance?
questions.explanation:
A duck.

	Kramer is the one who recommends Poppie's to Elaine and Jerry because Kramer and Poppie are making a business together where customers of the restaurant get to make their own pizza pie by hand.  Kramer originally thought of this idea in an earlier episode, but never actually brought it to life until now.

False.

	Poppie's mother died on the high seas.  She was taken to a slave labor camp when Poppie was twelve, and when she was finally set free twelve years later, she died on a boat to the United States while eating some bad fish.  Poppie tells this to Elaine and Jerry when they're getting ready to eat.

questions.text: Why does Elaine break up with her boyfriend and not eat at Poppie's restaurant?
questions.correct: Because of his views on abortion
options: Because they shopped at Pottery Barn
Because they both don't wash their hands in the bathroom
Because they're both obsessed with women
questions.explanation:
Because of his views on abortion.

	When Elaine tells Jerry that she won't eat at a certain pizza place because of the owner's support for anti-abortion groups, Jerry takes the opportunity to ask for his views on the topic.  Unluckily, his mother was bearing a child when she was kidnapped, so Elaine decides not to eat Poppie's succulent duck.

questions.text: What do Jerry and Elaine buy for Poppie when he's in the hospital?
questions.explanation:
Wine and chili.

	When Kramer asks them what they did, Jerry and Elaine start to feel sorry about the ordeal, so they send Poppie a bottle of wine and a jar of five-alarm chili as a gift when he's in the hospital.  Poppie takes this in a bad way since he has an intestinal disorder, because if he'd used the gift, he'd die.

questions.text: What is the name of the man who rented "Breakfast at Tiffany's"?
questions.explanation:
Joe.

	Since George decided not to read his book for the book club, Jerry suggested that he rent the movie, "Breakfast at Tiffany's" and pretend that he'd read it.  When he goes to video stores, they're all rented, so he looks up one of the names on the computer and goes to the man's apartment to get the movie.

questions.text: Poppie peed on Jerry's new sofa.
questions.explanation:
True.

	When Poppie visited Jerry for the duck money, Kramer asked him to sit down on the sofa.  Poppie left to get ready for the make-your-own-pie premiere and Jerry realized that Poppie peed on his sofa.  Jerry ends up asking Elaine for his old couch since he decides that he simply can't sit on the couch anymore.

questions.text: What topping did Kramer want on his pizza that Poppie didn't like?
questions.explanation:
Cucumbers.

	The make-your-own-pie idea was going well until Kramer decided that he wanted cucumbers on top of it.  Much like people with the abortion issue, Poppie decided that it couldn't be placed on the pizza and it was a pizza from the moment that the hands knead the dough while Kramer felt it was only a pizza when it came out of the oven.

questions.text: What do both Elaine and George spill on a couch in the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Juice.

	In the end, George spills grape juice on Joe's couch and is forced to give the Temples his couch.  Jerry gives the Poppie-stained couch to George and tries to get his old couch back from Elaine.  When the mover comes to pick it up, Elaine offers him a glass of grape juice, but the bottle breaks on the couch.
